resources.string: This application provides a variety of calculators for matched betting. It is expected that the user has prior knowledge of matched betting strategies. The appropriate lay stakes and profits are calculated and displayed automatically on input of data.\n\nThe application also includes a ‘Bet Reminder’ function to set notification reminders at a time in the future.

This calculator is used for normal matched betting calculations. Firstly, make sure you select the correct type of bet: 

● Qualifier: Standard back and lay bet. Also used for arbitrage bets 
● SNR (Stake not returned free bet) : Bookmaker fee bet which returns only the winnings from the free bet and not the stake 
● SR (Stake returned free bet): Bookmaker free bet which returns the stake with the winnings

Enter the relevant input details to show results. Results can be displayed as normal, underlay, overlay or custom. Selecting custom will allow you to vary the lay stake using the slider bar.

Calculator also used for partially matched bets where the original lay bet did not get fully matched. Select ‘Partially Matched’ and enter the details of the partially matched bet. Make sure to set the current market lay odds in the main input data and the appropriate lay stakes will be calculated to match the bet.

Used for each way matched bets and each way extra place offers. Select correct type of bet: Qualifier, SNR or SR and enter relevant input data to show results. Check the ‘Extra Place Offer’ checkbox to also show potential profit of an extra place if the bookmaker is paying out more places than the exchange.

Used for offers where the bookmaker refunds stake on losing bets as either cash or free bet. If the refund is cash set the ‘Refund Retention’ to 100%. If the refund is a free bet set this to the percentage of the free bet you expect to turn into cash (typically 70%-80%). The results will show the required lay stake to lock in a profit.

Used for offers where the bookmaker refunds stakes as either cash or free bet due a specific outcome or trigger happening. For example, a refund on bets on a football game if a specific player scores, or a refund on a horse racing bet if the favourite wins. As well as laying the initial bet, the refund trigger can be layed as well to lock in a profit. Can also be used for 4/1 offers, in which case the refund trigger is the same as the initial bet and overall lay stake would be the sum of the initial and refund trigger lay stakes shown in the results.

Used for offers where the bookmaker pays out early during an event. For example, they pay out a football team as the winner if they go 2 goals up during the game. At this point, an in-play back bet can be placed to lock in a profit. The in-play back bet should only ever be placed after the early payout has been triggered. Use the slider to vary the in-play back bet stake if you do not wish to lock in a profit.
Converts between decimal, fractional and American odds. Also shows implied probability.

Searches real time odds for various UK bookmakers for upcoming English Premier League football games. The bets are shown based on the best rating for matched bet (100% rating = 100% of bookmaker stake retained after playing qualifying matched bet). Click on the bet to open in calculator.
Shows a list of the saved bets on the device. Click on the bet to open in calculator.
